lowy_ap2hxAAVdFyh1KQGA.text: I just found this treasure. Sadly, I have been passing it for years. Absolutely delicious, highly recommended, you will not be disappointed!

UEU3Dgc2PlVgHHtV84ti_Q.text: I'm Colombian born and raised in Miami, so my review has descent accreditation.  This is by far the best Colombian bakery I have been to outside of Colombia and Miami.  This is a 100% authentic Colombian and Venezuelan bakery. Stuffed arepas are to die for and so are all of the items they have.  Operated by the super friendly owners.  I've lived in Charlotte for one year and have been waiting to find something like this ever since.  This will be my new second home.

Hd-1gCSTw3SJs1m27G9F6Q.text: Delicious. Stopped in for my first time and tried an Arepa with pork and cheese.  Simple and delicious.  If this place was a food truck or open late at night, the lines would be crazy.  I can't imagine a more perfect hangover sandwich, so I plan on hitting it next time I have had a rough night.   The menu looks pretty impressive and I can't wait to try the rest of it out.  The hours are a bit limited, so look what time it is before you head over, but definitely head over.

KZSBFTbIXkn7GrISyBmspg.text: Great little family bakery with great pastry and juices.  The owners are so nice and passionate about what they do.  Can't wait to come back.  Really love their empanadas.

W5gRTTYTG8C5L6IEbbEXHg.text: You immediately feel welcome when you come in; this hidden gem has everything you need for a flavorful experience definitely recommend it.

pXLYF1honF1Vdboao7aCDg.text: Tucked away in a small strip next to a Gas station is a little gem of a place called Lucy"s Bakery. Very nice owner who explained his culture and his food items to us. Wonderful Empanadas and Arepa's . Such delicious pastries with Dulce and Guava ! Cute little storefront restaurant..worth the drive if you are in Charlotte But only open till 5 PM on weekdays..so come early!!

FYDpQtvdqxPjRtkSNSdA0Q.text: Excellent Venezuelan style arepas. My favorite is the Reina Pepiada.  Owner is very friendly and helpful. Very casual atmosphere.  Truly delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States

r9VFQA5TlVSlKsv6F_dgcQ.text: I can't recommend this hidden gem more. Ignore the strip mall location and step inside for the opportunity to try a wide variety of pastries, empanadas, tamales, arepas and more. I came in wanting to get a variety of things to try as a celebratory dinner for two and the owner was so kind and helpful and put me an amazing already with reheating instructions. Everything was good and you can tell they care. I will be back!

LuBtkVUv7HW03rESz9kEqg.text: Great little hidden secret in an unassuming strip center in Stallings.  My husband, son and I tried it for the first time yesterday at lunch and will definitely be back.  The customer service was amazing and the food was great.  Good place to go to support small local businesses!

H0ClRtvVvT7JuIo3Adv8ZA.text: I come here for a to go lunch once a month...been doing so for a few years.  I always look forward to it and am never disappointed.  As others have stated, once you walk in you know you are in for something different and the smell is wonderful.  It is places like this that makes one love food.  Thank you!

H9SEDALtfVmebISKJWIFLw.text: The best mom and pop, hole in the wall place. Every time we are in town, we come to Lucy's! Empanadas are the best!

vGfyi2xQrWlnMyXQbzkZuw.text: I live around the corner from this restaurant and after countless times of passing by decided to stop by for lunch. Best decision ever! I tried all the empanadas ( don't judge me)  and the Cuban sandwich. Everything was delish! The owners are very sweet. So far I love living here in NC. ( moved from California a month ago) I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. Cuban Sandwich

5heVGxSDbtFO37iqHvCpPA.text: So friendly! Great service even better food! The empanadas are exceptional and the prices are more than reasonable. One of my favorite local spots.

ob9OO1rVKnBHC7F1pDzysw.text: Went here for Cuban and was a bit disappointed - the owners are very nice and sweet but the sandwiches missed with not enough filling and too much bread. I loved my material but the guava pastelitos were lacking in flavor- a little spoonful of guava filling and too much puff pastry . Overall not what I'm used to for Cuban .

dsrV8Q2Z9l1_RiiDM0bM4Q.text: If there were 6 stars, I'd rate it that! Try the Reina  Pepiada! Everything is fresh made and so delicious.  You HAVE to try this place! Eric is the best!

yQYgJcxiM2EK5mvWno0ElA.text: The food is absolutely delicious. I had a beef empanada, which came with an sauce. I also tried the Cuban Sandwich, BBq sandwich, and "Lucy's favorite" sandwich, all of which were to my satisfaction. I would also suggest grabbing a Yerba Mate Soda out of the fridge. The owner is extremely friendly and kind. He would come check on my table to see if we had any questions or suggestions. The only thing I can say bothered was a strange occurrence. When my friends and I sat down,we all started to have watering eyes. I don't know if it was because of something they were cooking with, but as much as we tried to ignore the burning sensation, we all tears running down our cheeks.

uB_ptTcwryz7vlQNW_f2ag.text: Delicious pastries. Very nice staff. Clean and welcoming. I recommend trying it, if you're in the area. A hidden gem. I enjoyed the beef empanada.

xuXoOVySm22aq-10H4mJzQ.text: "As good as it gets" is an understatement, it only gets better and better. My husband and I have recently moved to Charlotte and we've spent so many times trying to find a good Venezuelan spot, and finally this is IT! From the moment we went in we got greeted by a gentleman, very courteous and patient, we had no idea what to get. We finally ordered arepas and cachapas, however my husband made a switch from the chicken with avocado, to shredded beef with layered avocado. Needless to say it was devoured in seconds because it was SO good. I had a shredded beef arepa and a cachapa with cheese. The next time we went back, I ordered the cachapa with cheese and shredded beef. The food here is amazing, and I really can not begin to think that anyone else here would say otherwise. I spoke to the woman who made our food and she was so sweet and kind. They back you feel at home, and welcomed. Every time we go the food just gets better and better. If I can come here everyday, I would. Thank you Lucy's Bake & Deli!!

GJw2sA6lHRLhVoATID1qRQ.text: The Cuban, Roman or Colombian with black sausage are amazing, their Empanada are also very good.  I frequently come and get takeout, and friends ask me to bring them sandwiches at work.  Best sandwiches of this type in Charlotte.

i3o5Yzj3C4anqJTmrU3sbw.text: For a small deli/cafe, the food and staff couldn't be any better. It's the type of place where if you go every once and a while, you'll soon be part of the family. Auri and Eric are a wonderful couple and their love for good food is baked into everything they make. Normally one wouldn't expect to find great columbian food in North Carolina but this is as good as it gets without going straight there.

t-PC9A85nV-h0Xn-gvDNVQ.text: Great Cuban sandwiches, empanadas, and the Torigallo is fantastic! This is my second time and it is definitely a hidden gem.

fs8AOjA_5XDEjX4XVPYCGQ.text: The food here is great.The owner is very nice.I love the Cuba coffee. Great place nice and very clean.

mgeSEHQ5CXxdfyYHRLLsyw.text: One day as I drove down Potters road, this place caught my eye. I was hungry; their signs drew me in. I stepped in to find my new favorite spot I now look forward to at the end of the week. On Fridays, I usually stop by to bring home 4 of their Cuban Sandwiches. Then Saturday morning, my wife and I usually get their arepas and empanadas. Man are those empanadas delicious.   I definitely recommend this spot if you are nearby.

K1lJ4m-rv4vTjVXieZqmPw.text: Great little spot. We stop in after going to the Y to grab some empanadas, and sometimes they have candy from Venezuela that we love. The people are wonderful....I always feel welcome. Last time I had an arepa sandwich con pollo y avocado. WOW! It was great....When we go to parties and need to bring a dish, we order 20-30 empanadas to take with us....nice presentation, and delicious. Great little place to stop by!   Mike and Carolina...

nMfJi-H-QabKu6R5ujKN0g.text: Oh my god. I can't even say enough good things about this little deli off the beaten path! Go! Go! Go! They have both Venezuelan and Argentinian empanadas. They have Columbian sausages and some of the best Aji Picante. They probably also have the best Tres Leches cake I have ever had. Go and try everything. This place is a Latin lovers paradise!

84YAlP9KbgECgPF3fhRG6A.text: This restaurant is one of my favorite restaurant   Try the Cuban sandwich!!  Owner is very nice and have a lot of Selection of food it a must try

Vgh4zXlioYY72j3pFEXc0Q.text: This place is so wonderful. It's very quaint and understated but don't let that fool you, the food is to die for. Lucy's offers the most traditionally prepared Argentinian food in all of Charlotte. I absolutely devoured my empanada and my Cuban sandwich. The services was wonderful, very friendly, and accommodating. The Maracuya was fantastic over all a really nice meal and a really great experience for a place almost in the middle of no where.

7pjQvhqtPhttiyHbdJwVOQ.text: Awesome food, a great change of pace from the regular local offerings.  The avocado and chicken arepa (reina pepiada) is great, Cuban and Roman sandwiches are to die for.    My only complaint is that 6pm is too early to close, wish you were open later at least one night a week so I could pick up dinner on the way home from work.

-ZcFq90tPaJwc1w2NVtLbA.text: Went here for the first time today after driving past for years. What a gem! Authentic Venezuelan/Columbia's food prepared to order by the owners. Good, friendly service, outstanding food and the owners take pride in their business. I had a Cuban sandwich, my wife had a Cuban platter and both were great.  Next time I want to try breakfast. Venezuelan and Columbia's specialties I've never had, but look forward to.

eSEvfEHJeXMNRDwPsxwD7A.text: Authentic variety of tasty selections. The Cuban sandwich is the best! Good customer service. Our first visit and we will be back! I look at the sanitation rating wherever we go and theirs was a 100.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States

DQ0U0Y_WXZZr6Oae9-NwdA.text: Excellent food very tasty and great service I will recommend this place to all my friends

gWMdg50HZbsKLg8j-qA3wg.text: A most pleasant place.  While most people give this restaurant five stars I am giving it four because I seldom give five  stars.  The food we had was very satisfying.    There are four booths for sit down service.  This place is very clean which I appreciate.  The people are friendly and the food fresh.  I like to support small business and this place is worth supporting.

K83QGqxkmyX_Hu6Hhy7glw.text: Everything is good at Lucy's: sandwiches, arepas, empanadas, sweets, even the coffee are something special. The people there are friendly and accommodating and will explain the menu and make suggestions if you aren't sure what to order, but you really can't go wrong!

3fdYQQ1J__sg0MpZXIXrCA.text: A friend from work recommended this place so me and my wife went to check it out. One of us had the venezuelan platter and the other had the Cuban platter, the platters were pretty much the same, one was with pork and the other beef, then the rest of the platter was rice, plantains, and black beans. Platters were $9.99 so reasonable and the food was good. The staff was very nice and helpful. I will definitely go back.

P6rbUgE1v-XoNV3vJV_HAQ.text: This is a great little restaurant.   The owners are so friendly and the food is so good.   We usually eat empanadas, but today we tried cachapas and they may be our new favorite.

tVGgdP2L_y1MrnFxPsm_yw.text: Great food and the owners are friendly.  We look forward to returning.  The breakfast menu looks good.

Qr_XQUN2nC97Wb37ERQfig.text: Awesome experience. Eric and his wife always willing to serve. Had Tequenos, empanadas de Pabellon, cachapas and cafe con leche.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States

DEwd2bBlNrtBDKy6apewkw.text: A great spot. Venezuelan specialties as well as empanadas and arepas. We tried the beef empanada with both house made sauces on the side and it was excellent. We also had a cuban sandwich and Lucy's favorite, both of which were top notch. Eric was a great host and took time to explain all the different options. The restaurant is small and very well cared for. Skip the local chains and all the familiar spots and grab lunch here. There also serve breakfast all day.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. Lucy&#39;s Favorite. Chicken. Avocado. Garlic sauce. Really good.

4qZuCgQp8vmlx3Xj1eetKg.text: We tried Lucy's after I did a search of places in Stallings and saw all of the great reviews. It didn't disappoint! My husband got the Venezuelan platter and I got the Reina Pepiada. We also had the spinach empinanda. Everything was delicious!!! We finished the meal with the tres leches cake, and it was amazing. The owner was so nice and told us about all of the foods, what to try, etc. We will definitely be back. I want to try everything on the menu!!

O3jWGlbd85-8vC3Eu4RHdQ.text: This is my favorite place.  I feel like when I was back home every time I came in..... husband and wife run this place. It's a perfect combination. Wife focus in amazing Latin American (Venezuelan, Colombian etc) comfort food and husband focus in latin carisma and love for you neighbor personality. They are so sweet that the food with their amazing service is like an unreal experience. I wish them their best and cant wait to come for some empanada and arepas for brunch Saturday.

FikMVU2LrZsccTbS5XdbCQ.text: I stumbled across Lucy's while looking at bakeries on Yelp. I saw they served arepas and empanadas and decided to stop by. So happy I did. They are so friendly and the gentleman took time to tell me about some of their different items. The food was delicious and fresh.  I will definitely be back!

EyNmGHnjNmBLhwoaIua1XQ.text: Small low key place BUT  their Cuban sandwich is the best in Charlotte. If you are a fan of Cuban sandwiches make sure you treat yourself to one at Lucy's.

fFAUEYDiZJ8QS31QUlF1fQ.text: We tried Lucy's based on reviews on Yelp.  We walked and our first thought was that the reviews were nuts.  It is most underwhelming in appearance.  Apparently, though, they chose to care more about the food than the decor.  We both had arepas and they were amazing.  The proprietor was very patient and helpful in our selection.  If you have never been there, don't get put off by the spartan interior.  The food is well worth the visit.

MKGnTFSl2cZJAaBp_WAamg.text: A hidden gem in Stallings. Incredible service and amazing food, especially the Venezuelan arepas, cachapas, empanadas and tequenos! I can't go a week without it.

RUbT4wM6uEBVVe4g_cG8-A.text: LOVED this place. Everything we got was outstanding. Empanada.. awesome (their house made garlic sauce was great!). I got the Roman sandwich which is a twist on a Cuban but Colombian sausage instead of mojo pork. I used their house made hot sauce on it... it was a sweet and spicy "Tabasco" type..also awesome! My wife and daughter each got arepas.. both were superb (daughter got the beef, wife got the chicken avocado).  I can't wait to go back and try their Cuban which was voted one of the best in Charlotte!

1cH-dE2gKCXnFuxe2dBLNQ.text: Loved the arepa I had for lunch--the breakfast arepa with egg, bacon, ham and cheese! It was a wonderful white corn arepa stacked with delicious breakfast goodies. They serve breakfast all day, so this is quickly becoming my new favorite place. My friend had the capacha arepa made with sweet corn, cheese and pork. It was fantastic and huge!! We both noticed they had many options for lunch also and Columbian food like plantains and roast meat. We wanted to try dessert but we were full. It seems like more of a deli than a bakery.  Parking in the back lot was easier than fitting into the spaces off Potter Rd. I am so excited to return for more goodies!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. Breakfast arepa--egg, bacon, ham and cheese
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. Capacha arepa with pork

qtOes_qa6O2Eg5cSDBEtLQ.text: This restaurant was recommended by another yelp elite at the last event we went to.   My husband and I were out that way and decided to stop in for lunch.   After waiting in line to order for about 5-8 minutes we finally ordered. I got an arepa stuffed with chicken, cheese and avocado and my husband got the Venezuelan platter which included beef, beans, rice and plantains.   We waited about 10-15 minutes for our food. The owner could tell my husband was fading some so he brought over a complimentary bread (it had a name but the English explanation was tapioca bread) it was very good and so sweet of the owner to bring it over.   The food came out hot and was fantastic!!!!  So fresh and so well seasoned. The owner and his wife do all the cooking. They are sooo proud of their restaurant and for good reason - it's honestly excellent!!!  This little hole in the wall is SO worth the trip and the wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. The wonderful owner brought us a complimentary tapioca bread!

ox3AM0cpSNSfFkORNXT7zA.text: I'll start by saying that they are very friendly and the bakery seems clean and neat. Since moving to charlotte I've been on the hunt for REAL cafe con leche along with authentic latin food and I haven't been very successful.   I asked if they served cafe con leche and they assured me that they did, but then served me coffee from a Nescafe machine which is NOT how you make REAL cafe con leche. The coffee was good but it was NOT cafe con leche.   The cachapa was ok, but it was a bit soggy and sitting in water. Overall I doubt I'll return. My hunt for real cafe con leche and authentic latin food continues. Moving from Miami has set the bar very high when it comes to latin food and latin culture.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. Cachapas. They were pretty good, but a bit soggy and sitting in water.

v2q-gK0yKathFj1qrja1aQ.text: Authentic Colombian/Venezuelan food that is prepared with the freshest ingredients, herbs, and spices. Owned by a lovely couple who enjoy engaging with their customers. Food is cooked with the passion and love latinos are known for. No bland menu items. Not salty either. Delicious and bursting with flavor.   Although preparations and taste of certain items are not similar to my cultural puerto rican dishes, I still devoured what I ordered with mucho gusto.   If you like a little spice, ask for their freshly made hot sauce.   Have a sweet tooth, they also bake fresh everyday fruit filled puff pastries and more.   Make it a point to try each of their fresh empanadas until you find the one your heart soars for. I hear the chicken empanada is a favorite.  Just be prepared to walk into a slice of Colombia and Venezuela where the food is cooked and tastes just like in one of their homes.  Bien provecho!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States

fUw0yUb13xbrGnyb9YqhPA.text: Just picked up a made-to-order Reina arepa. So much flavor in one arepa! Will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. Reina arepa to go!!

muaQeXlbn7dlhtY9kd465A.text: Being latino I was shocked to find this little gem in Stallings. But it checks all of my boxes and passed all my tests. Super friendly on the inside and if you're curious about trying something new. This is the spot.

ylrdScbDDN6fjyWUEG74UQ.text: So glad to find this locally owned establishment they have great empanadas. The menu has a great variety of options. Great place for lunch

qbJQiEHvm5Q5CK7H9_Y4NA.text: Man oh man, what a diamond in the rough! Very unassuming place in a strip mall beside a gas station. Excellent empanadas and pastries. Very welcoming owner/manager.  We had both Colombian style and Argentinian style empanadas. I'm fond of the Colombian style with the corn breading, really enjoy the crunch. Everything here is made daily.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States
Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States

dGSQpe_-hXnzeZCnm1vDbw.text: Nice Venezuelan restaurant/bakery. Order first then self seated.  We went for breakfast:served all day. Had Colombian breakfast platter: Arepa is a thick white corn tortilla with two over easy eggs. They are good and can fill you up, but need to season it to your taste, just imagine grit patty with eggs. They have hot sauce, and even hotter sauce, along with garlic sauce upon request. Also come with a mixture of rice, beans and shredded beef. Very good flavor, add hot sauce for spice. Cachapa is sweet corn pancake. You can have it with cheese or cachapa fascia comes with cheese and shredded beef. This is my favorite. Very good flavor with a hint of sweetness.   I had the Arepa with shredded chicken also. You can have Arepa with breakfast items also. This Arepa is like a pita made of corn flour, stuffed with whatever meat you want.   They also had a varieties of pastry to choose from. I had shredded beef empanada. Venezuela empanadas shell are made with corn flour, unlike other empanadas in other countries made with wheat flour. I like these best out of all other empanadas I have eaten around the world.  The coffees was nice a smooth. You can also have it with cinnamon, to give it a nice kick.   Definitely will be back, even if it's a 30 drive for us. Recommend!

crm7FXOThALsAGM4oIeKVQ.text: What a diamond in the rough. Traditional Venezuelan and Colombian style food. If you don't know what to get, ask for a suggestion, they will point you in the right direction. Eric has been great at making the right suggestions for me  Try the Reina Pepiada soooo good.  This is the type of place that may go unnoticed as you drive by, but it the type of place that you will never visit once. Don't expect to run in and out, good food takes time!!!!   Omg the coffee is to die for. Get a cafe con leche

ib45yVWdCthKDaqpLOHH4A.text: Great arepas!!!!! Had the Colombian enpanada and it was also delicious. Talk to the staff they have great suggestions on what to eat.   Can't go wrong here with anything you order

97YW2bj4xCjMAEWuREfkNg.text: This place is awesome! Im Venezuelan and This bakery is a real Venezuelan place. 100% recommended!

Z75poFcg98pdzl8PdabUow.text: Loved the Roman Sandwich, one of their top sellers I understand. Great and friendly staff. My wife enjoyed her Cuban Platter. We can't wait to come back for breakfast items.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucy's Bake & Deli - Stallings, NC, United States. The Roman Sandwich!

IFM6v-dD5c71sXsI1YTNJQ.text: I ordered the Cuban sandwich and tres leches. I have never had a cuban sandwich because in all honesty the ingredients didn't seem appealing (I'm not a big fan of mustard and pickles). I ordered it because that seemed to be a popular choice at Lucy's. IT WAS DELICIOUS! Savory and a burst of flavor.  So glad I discovered this gem just 10 minutes from my house. The tres leches was also very yummy. If you've had a meal you'll need to share half or save some for later.

ai9UBKDvBaXBwx5vWGpULA.text: Best food with the best Sazon!!!!! Highly recommend Lucy's bakery! And Eric and Lucy are amazing owners!!!

q4v_079FFp3pny29HeP1Rw.text: As a Venezuelan native it's so so hard to find authentic Venezuelan food anywhere. I came in with so much hope and wow I was blown away. The food is just like I remember my family making it. It was everything I could have hoped for and will be back!!!

ZmaVy-CW-6ImFNMY2FgD_A.text: Yes yes yes. Omg the food is good.  Best empanada hands down. Arepas are very flavorful.

Hv4nHPIZz7cQPG6r33yCqA.text: 10/10. Hidden gem with surprisingly giant and delicious sandwiches! I got Lucy's Favorite Sandwich, and it was fantastic! I will definitely come back again!

Kk8bV6kkToXI0rRb1ti08A.text: Get the cachapa! My boys love it. There is so much deliciousness here. The Arepas are True Venezuelan! Family owned and you can buy the white cheese if they haven't sold out.  Every time we go we have a delicious experience.
